messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I’m not able to see your location, so I’ll need a bit more information. Could you tell me what details you’re looking for (e.g., a city, an address, nearby landmarks), or share any coordinates you have?
I don't have any details or coordinates.

I don’t have any way to determine your location automatically. If you want help figuring out where you are, here are a few approaches you can try:

1. Use your phone or computer’s built-in location feature  
   • On most smartphones, open Maps (Google Maps, Apple Maps, etc.) and tap the “current-location” button.  
   • On a computer, many map websites let you click a “locate me” icon in the corner.

2. Check your device’s settings for the current coordinates  
   • iPhone: Settings → Privacy & Security → Location Services (some apps list your GPS info).  
   • Android: Settings → Location → See “Google Location Accuracy” or similar.  
   • Laptop: Some operating systems (Windows, macOS) show approximate location under privacy/location settings.

3. Look up your public IP address  
   • Search “What is my IP” in a browser, then use an IP-geolocation site.  
   • This only gives an approximate city or region, not an exact address.

4. Ask nearby landmarks or signs  
   • Street names, mile markers, or business names can help identify where you are.

5. If you have any coordinates later  
   • Share the latitude/longitude and I can look up the address for you.

Let me know if you’re able to gather any of that information and I’ll gladly help interpret it.
I’ll give those suggestions a try and see what I can find.

Sounds good! If you’re able to get any coordinates, a street name, a nearby landmark, or even just the city or region, let me know and I’ll help you pinpoint the location. Feel free to reach out whenever you have more details.
